notes:
This data was compiled by Statistics Without Borders (SWB) following an activation request to the Digital Humanitarian Network (DHN) from the Assessment Capacities Project (ACAPS). It is a compilation of the [MICS](http://www.childinfo.org/files/Nepal_MICS_2014_Key_Findings_Report.pdf) 2014 data (Government of Nepal and UNICEF)  and the CBS (Central Bureau of Statistics) [census data](http://cbs.gov.np/) from 2011 

Administrative Level 3 boundaries from the Survey Department of Nepal were then merged into the 15 Nepalese Eco-Regions, and the compiled data joined to the Eco-Regions based on unique names by GIScorps, who also produced a visualization [here](http://giscorps.maps.arcgis.com/apps/webappviewer/index.html?id=7d4f5ee9702a4c07a5c50c9bf81a17e9).  This visualization is also available on the [UN Nepal Information Platform](http://un.org.np/)
